title: Activist investor ValueAct takes $1.2 billion stake in Citi - WSJ
text:
May 7, 2018 / 9:17 PM / in 25 minutes Activist investor ValueAct takes $1.2 billion stake in Citi - WSJ Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
(Reuters) - Activist investor ValueAct Capital Partners LP has built a roughly $1.2 billion (884.89 million pounds) stake in Citigroup Inc ( C.N ), the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday. FILE PHOTO: A view of the exterior of the Citibank corporate headquarters in New York, New York, U.S. May 20, 2015. REUTERS/Mike Segar/File Photo
ValueAct, which has built the position over the past four to five months, continues to boost it “opportunistically”, according to the report.
The stake amounts to about 0.7 percent of Citigroup, which has a market value of $175 billion, WSJ said. Reporting by Diptendu Lahiri in Bengaluru; Editing by Shounak Dasgupta
